page.title: 05Hop Farming near Rye
page.content: I went to see a local hop grower and he said that we have hops to make beer. The plants stay in the ground from year to year. In the spring they are cut back, strung, dressed and when they are 2 feet tall they are trained on the strings and then sprayed every ten days until September. The hops are cut in the hop garden by men going through rows with knives. They are then put on a machine which takes the hops off the strings. They are then taken to the oast house to be dried. Afterwards they are taken to a central collection point at Paddock Wood.
